reporting-org.narrative: Centre de recherches pour le développement international
Centro Internacional de Investigaciones para el Desarrollo

title.narrative: Activités de gouvernance de l'Initiative de recherche concertée sur l'adaptation en Afrique et en Asie en 2012-2013
Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative for Africa and Asia Governance Activities 2012-2013

description.narrative:
The Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative for Africa and Asia (CARIAA) is a new seven-year donor partnership between the UK's Department for International Development (DFID) and IDRC, which will run until 2019. The program supports collaborative research on three 'hot spots' selected for their combination of significant biophysical climate change impacts and high risks due to inhabitation by a large population whose adaptive capacities are limited by poverty. CARIAA aims to inform adaptation policy and practice by providing evidence on how to increase the resilience of vulnerable populations in these hot spots in Africa and South Asia.
The program will support three consortia, one per hot spot, to conduct the research. Consortia will be selected through a competitive, global, multistep approach, as reviewed and implemented by the CARIAA governance. The selection process is also expected to require reviews by technical experts. This research support project includes all activities of the CARIAA governance bodies until the selection of the consortia has been completed, and honoraria for outside peer reviews.
The governance structure for CARIAA has three components: the Advisory Committee on Science and Outreach (AC); the Executive Committee (EC), consisting of donor representatives and responsible for overseeing the program; and the CARIAA Team, consisting of IDRC staff responsible for designing and implementing the program strategy and providing support to consortia members. The AC will serve a consultative role only (no approval function), providing independent guidance and scientific advice as well as guidance on strategic outreach to the Executive Committee and the CARIAA Team. More specifically, the AC members roles will be: a) Providing scientific and policy advice: This will include reviewing both scientific content and policy engagement strategies of key background documents for the program and the consortia. b) Representing CARIAA: Committee members will also act as ambassadors for the program to help ensure its impact on policy and practice. They will use their networks with policymakers, researchers, and other stakeholders to raise awareness of the program and its results.
Methodology 1) Provision by AC of scientific and policy advice - Reviewing the results of background studies on the hot spots and other key research results, as requested; - Reviewing the eligibility and proposal selection criteria for consortia developed by the CARIAA Team, with attention to both scientific and policy engagement strategies; - Reviewing proposals for consortia and making recommendations for funding to the Executive Committee; - Identifying strategic entry points in the policy community prior to the commencement of consortia's research programs and for the duration of the program; - Providing guidance to the CARIAA Team in the development and implementation of an overarching analytical framework to extract aggregate level evidence; - Proposing eligibility and selection criteria for, and advising on outcomes of, any further calls for proposals as required; and - Responding to queries and requests from the Executive Committee as required on an ongoing basis. 2) Travel by AC members to Meetings/Events - Acting as ambassadors for CARIAA by facilitating relationships with partners and stakeholders, including policy makers at all levels-local, national, regional, and international; - Using professional networks as channels for the dissemination of key messages from CARIAA programming and results; and - Representing CARIAA at key strategic events as required throughout the program. 3) Peer Reviews of proposals - Experts will be identified and hired to conduct a review, as required, at different stages of the consortia selection process. Reviews can be conducted at the concept note stage, or at the full proposal stage.
Calendar of Activities for 2012/2013 Date: January 2013, London, UK Key Activities: - AC inception and governance strategy - Review of documents for the call for consortia - Review general progress e.g. Doha background studies meeting, Montreal consultations etc - EC deliberation of AC recommendations Date: May 2013, London, UK Key Activities: - Review of concept notes - EC deliberation of AC recommendations Date: Fall 2013, London, UK Key Activities: - Review of full proposals - EC deliberation of AC recommendations Date: Open - AC members represent CARIAA at key regional and global events
